faq.name: whatis_exult
faq.question: What is ?

answer.para:
Ultima 7, an RPG from the early 1990's, still has a huge following. But,
being a DOS game with a very non-standard memory manager, it is difficult
to run it on the latest computers. is a project to create
an Ultima 7 game engine that runs on modern operating systems, capable of
using the data and graphics files that come with the game.

is being developed in C++ under Linux, MacOS and Windows
using the SDL library to make porting to other platforms relatively easy.
The current version supports much of the game's plot, allowing you to
talk to NPCs, use items, solve quests, and even fight monsters. Music,
speech, and the full introduction are also implemented. This, and further
development, is only possible due to the work done by other fans who have
decoded the various Ultima 7 data files, especially Gary Thompson, Maxim
Shatskih, Jakob Shonberg, and Wouter Dijkslag.

aims to let those people who own Ultima 7 (copyright 1993)
play the game on modern hardware, in as close to (or perhaps even surpassing)
its original splendor as is possible. You need to own
"Ultima 7: The Black Gate" in order to use , and we encourage
you to buy a legal copy.

faq.name: why_name_exult
faq.question: Why is it called - what is the meaning of this name?

answer.cite:
I originally wrote it [Exult] solely for X-windows, so that's where
the 'X' comes from. The "ult", of course, comes from Ultima. It
was only about 6 months ago that I replaced the X code with SDL,
which is multiplatform. Then Arthuris ported it to Win32 (and to
BeOS). He had also ported the earlier version, but it was much harder
to maintain that way.

I'd like to point out that "exult" is also an English verb that
means "to rejoice, to exhibit great happiness".

faq.name: is_exult_free
faq.question: Is free ?

answer.para:
is more than free: it's Free (notice the caps). is released
under the GNU GPL (General Public License). This means that the source code
for is freely available and you can do whatever you want with it.
However, if you make modifications to any of 's components and publicly
redistribute your work you are required to make the source freely available
in turn. Obviously the team would be very grateful if any
modifications you make are contributed back to the main code, so that
everyone can benefit from them. If you want to work on just send an
e-mail to the team.
More information on the GNU GPL at .

faq.name: compile_linux_snapshot
faq.question: How do I compile a source code snapshot under Linux?

ol.li: Install the latest version of SDL ()

Extract the source code archive to ~/exult:
unzip exult.zip -d ~
Create a fresh install of U7. I'll assume that you've installed U7 in ~/ultima7

Run autogen.sh to create a configure script, then compile :
cd ~/exult; chmod u+x autogen.sh; ./autogen.sh; ./configure; make

Install and the data file:
cp exult ~/ultima7; mkdir ~/ultima7/data; cp ./data/exult.flx ~/ultima7/data

faq.name: path_config

answer.para: You have two choices on how to setup .

The other is a little more complicated but appeals to control freaks like me:
Make a directory c:\ultima7

Extract or install the two Ultima 7 games into the appropiate folder
("The Black Gate" to c:\ultima7\blackgate and "Serpent Isle" to c:\ultima7\serpentisle)
Extract the compiled to c:\ultima7
Now you have to edit the exult.cfg file like this:

You can either use the relative (./blackgate) or absolute (c:\ultima\blackgate) path
to point to the correct directory.

faq.name: sound_available
faq.question: Do music and sound effects play?

answer.para:
Yes. Music plays via MIDI and sounds quite like the original. Sound
effects either play via digital (.wav) sfx or also via MIDI. Even speech is supported.
You can change the way the music and the sound effects play via the
setup menu or the exult.cfg file.

faq.name: sound_horrible
faq.question: The sound effects sound horrible

answer.para:
Well the music plays okay but the sound effects sound horrible,
especially when opening a door. What's up?

This is due to the fact that the sfx is played using MIDI. For that to
work properly you need the proper soundfont selected for your card.
Not every soundcard supports soundfont-managing. Creative's AWE and Live!
series do support it.
If your card doesn't or you want to hear better sfx you are much better off
when you select wave sfx. The next section covers that!
If you have on of those cards that do allow soundfont-managing this is how you
should get some decent sound out of it (description only for Win32):

ol.li:
Load up the Control Panel, select "Multimedia Properties"
(or "Sounds and Multimedia"). Make sure that the MIDI playback
device is the right one. For the SB Live! it has to be
"SB Live! MIDI Synth". Don't choose "Microsoft Synth" or similar.

You need a Sound Font Manager. Creative either provides the
AWE-Control panel or the Vienna Sound Font Manager, other sound
card producers should have something similar. There also should be
some Soundfont files (*.sf2 or *.sbk)

Select Bank: 000 or Synth
Load 4gmgsmt.sf2 or similar (You may have to try around a bit).
Now go into the game and test how the music works and if the SoundFX sound okay.

answer.para:
Important notice:
MIDI sound effects are disabled in source code in 23.05.2001 PM and later snapshots.
The team decided to drop MIDI sfx and with the next release it will no longer be
supported and this answer will disappear.

faq.name: wave_sfx
faq.question: How do I enable to play digital wave sfx?

answer.para:
You have to set a path to the sfx pack in the waves settings in exult.cfg (see ).
If you leave this blank the sfx will be played through MIDI. You have to download
seperate packs for each game as order of the sfx in BG and SI varies a bit and
otherwise will sound odd. However there is a little issue with sfx playback in SI (see ).
Note that configuring your soundfonts is not needed for digital wave sfx.

The sfx pack made by Joseph Morris can be found at
(4.55 MB) for "The Black Gate"
and (6.01 MB) for "Serpent Isle".
He recorded the original 114 sfx used in Black Gate which must
have been a lot of work. If your soundcard doesn't support soundfonts
this pack is a "must-have". Enjoy!

faq.name: sound_turnoff
faq.question: How to turn off audio?

Press s (or Esc in snapshots dated 29.04.2001 or later) to turn

faq.name: scaler
faq.question: What does the Scale option mean?

answer.para:
By default runs at 320x200 (which is the resolution the original
Ultima VII used). uses different scaling engines to
double the size to 640x400 and increase the quality of the graphics.
More information on the excellent scaling engine by Derek Liauw is available at
.
The scalers also work with higher resolutions. To change the scaling method either
use the menu or change your exult.cfg - see .
"2xSaI" is the new scaler, "bilinear" is the old one, "point" duplicates the pixels,
"interlaced" is the same as "point" except misses every other line, "SuperEagle" is
another scaler by Derek (the author of 2xSaI). Try them out to see how they look and which
you like best.
Your screen should be set to 16-bit color mode.

Within the game you can use the Alt + and Alt -
to switch resolution. The game will save the last
selected mode and reuse it the next time you run .

faq.name: case_sensitiveness
faq.question: Is case sensitive?

answer.para:
Case sensitiveness is a slight problem with when you are
not using the Windows port.
tries lower and uppercase versions, and reports the error after
trying the last (ie. uppercase) filename. If the "static" directory and
the files within are uppercase you might run into problems. Better make
sure that all these are lowercase. When unzipping the Ultima files from
a zip in Linux you can set it to extract in lowercase with the "-L" switch
(e.g. 'unzip -L ultima7.zip').
In the lates snapshots this should be fixed.

To change your key bindings first edit the file defaultkeys.txt in your directory,
change the bindings and save the file (e.g. as my_keys.txt). Now you have to change exult.cfg
to use that file. You can even choose if you want to change your key bindings for BG or SI.
See the keys settings at . Change (default) to my_keys.txt.

During the game press h to see a help
screen with all the keys (for MacOS change Alt for Cmd - the in-game help screen shows the
correct key combination for MacOS).

answer.para:

faq.name: bg_improvements
faq.question:
Serpent Isle had many more improvements over Black Gate (keyring,
better paperdoll...). Will these be implemented?

answer.para:
Right now the main goal is to get the Black Gate 100% working. After
that it could be that some more things will be improved as far as it
is possible to implement these.

The keyring is not in Black Gate but there is the k key
which tries all the keys in the inventory to open a lock.

Recently Ryan added paperdoll support in Black Gate. Though it is

to look at. Very impressive. For this you need to have Serpent Isle
installed on your hard drive and you must set the path to it in exult.cfg
(see ). If an item seems to have disappeared

faq.name: other_improvements
faq.question: Any other improvements/features?

answer.para:
In recent snapshots (since 29th of April) a new game menu was added with an
improved sound settings box and a very much improved (awesome)
savegame box. This allows you much more savegames than the original (you should
run out of disc space before you run out of savegame slots), shows a screenshot of
the location you saved at, the members of your party, your stats, game time and the
date you actually saved. The game menu is opened via Esc and the save
game box is opened either via the game menu or the s key.

In , you can still move your party even if there is a box/body/stats
open/on. In the original, the world was kind of frozen. Now it is only
frozen if you hit the t or s key.

faq.name: disable_improvements
faq.question: How do I disable all improvements?

answer.para:
To get an Ultima 7 that looks and behaves as close to the original as possible there
are several things to do (though I wonder why you'd want to do that):

ul.li:
make custom keybindings files (see ) in which you disable
all the keys that were not in the original for Black Gate and Serpents Isle.
In snapshots dated 29.04.2001 or later you have to assign s to old_file_gump
to enable the old savegame menu (the line in your custom keybindings file should look like:
S old_file_gump)
Edit the exult.cfg file to point to those custom keys.

Don't set the path to the Serpent Isle files (see ) and put
SI and a second copy of in a seperate directory (note: you can no longer launch both
BG and SI from the same exult.exe). This disables SI paperdolls in BG.

Alternatively you can leave the cheat menu binding in the keybindings file (F2)
and disable "Paperdolls" each time you run .
Edit the exult.cfg to use the resolution of 320x200, to run in full screen and disable scalers.

The disc icon in the Avatar paperdoll opens the new game menu. As of now this cannot be altered.
Sorry!

is a map-editor for , allowing you to modify the map of a

answer.para: Tristan

Currently, you need to be running on X (Linux, Unix, etc.), with
set to run in a window (not fullscreen). You also need the GTK+
library installed.

faq.name: port_platforms
faq.question: When will it be ported to other platforms?

answer.para:
That depends on when someone volunteers to do the work :-) There are
three issues:
GTK has to be ported to the platform. I think this is already
true for Win32.
uses sockets to communicate with . This also
shouldn't be a problem for Win32.
X drag-n-drop is used to put new objects on the landscape. The
'drop' part of this will have to be rewritten for Win32 , OR,
drag-n-drop could be an enhancement to SDL someday.

faq.name: how_to_run
faq.question: How do you run it?

answer.para:
You can run all by itself, but it isn't useful that way,
as it uses as a server. What you really want to do is:
Put 'exult_studio.glade' in the 'data' directory.
Be sure 'exult_studio' is in your path.
Run .
Press 'alt-ctrl-m' to go into 'map-editor' mode. If all is set
up correctly, exult_studio will start up, and will have a list of files
on the left side of its window.

You can also start up one or the other separately, and they'll
reconnect:
If isn't running, start it up. Then, in ,
use the 'File' menu to choose the static directory (for the game you're
playing).
If isn't running start it up with:
exult_studio -x (path to dir containing exult_studio.glade) -d (path to game directory)

faq.name: what_can_do_at_moment
faq.question: What can you do at the moment?

para.li: You can browse shapes in the main window.

You can drag a shape from the shape browser to , and that
object will be placed in the game. (Note: Not all such objects
are saved with the game yet; saving things like buildings will be
implemented soon.)

You can edit an 'egg' by double-clicking on it. An edit box
should appear.

You can create a new 'egg' using the pull-down menu in .
In the Egg edit box, after you hit 'Apply', you'll be prompted to
click in where you want the egg to appear.

If editing a 'monster' egg, you can set the monster by dragging
the shape from the browser to the area that displays the monster.

faq.name: what_next
faq.question: What's next?

answer.para:
The next things to be implemented are:
An NPC editor, similar to the one for Eggs (but with lots more
stuff to set).
A simple object editor, that lets you modify an object's
'quality', 'quantity' and flags.
A 'save-map' function in to save the whole map (not just
the moveable objects that 'save-game' stores).

faq.name: client_server_stuff
faq.question: What's with this client/server stuff?

answer.para:
A map-editor needs to provide the ability to display the game, place
objects on the map, and move objects around. That functionality is already in
, and it makes sense to reuse it. So we could have made a part of
. However, is already a huge program, and is getting
unwieldy to work on.

With this architecture, can have all the messy code for
displaying/editing dialog boxes, while only needs a little bit
of work to handle requests.

Also, I (Jeff) wanted to get a little experience programming with
sockets:-)
